title: The Life of the Fields
author: Jefferies, Richard, 1848-1887

quoteFirst: The year 1859 was remarkable for sun-spots, and on September 1, when two astronomers many miles apart were examining them, they both saw, all at once, a sudden cloud of light far brighter than the general surface of the sun burst out in the midst of a group of spots. The outburst began at
quoteLast: in the forenoon, and in five minutes it was gone again, but in that time it had swept across a space of 35,000 miles on the sun! Now both before and after this violent outburst took place a magnetic storm raged all round the earth, brilliant auroras were seen in all parts of the world, sparks flashed from the telegraph wires, and the telegraphic signalmen at Washington and Philadelphia received severe electric shocks.
title:
Through Magic Glasses and Other Lectures
A Sequel to The Fairyland of Science
author: Buckley, Arabella B. (Arabella Burton), 1840-1929
